SEARCH
Package com.conductor.core.model.permission

Interface Privilege

All Superinterfaces:
Option
All Known Implementing Classes:
EventPrivilege, OrganizationPrivilege
public interface Privilege extends Option
Privilege interface is used as a marker interface to reference a group of Option that represents a privilege to a Resource Note: Name of options within a privilege must be unique. Otherwise, safeCast will misbehave and might throw ClassCastException.

    getName

  • Method Details

    • safeCast

      static <E extends Enum<E> & Privilege> Optional<E> safeCast(Class<E> targetPrivilegeClass, String name)
      Safely casts a privilege name (string) into the specified Privilege enum type.

      This method should ALWAYS be used instead of raw casts or Enum.valueOf(), as it performs a case-insensitive lookup and guarantees type-safety.

      If the privilege name does not match any constant in the given enum class, an empty Optional is returned instead of throwing an exception.

      Example Usage

      

 Optional<OrganizationPrivilege> orgPrivilege =
         Privilege.safeCast(OrganizationPrivilege.class, "ADMIN");

      ⚠️ Important Warning

      • NEVER use raw casting like (Privilege) someEnum or anonymous objects. It will cause ClassCastException at runtime.
      • ALWAYS use safeCast(...) when converting from a string name to a Privilege, especially when reading from external sources such as JSON or the database.
      • This method is designed to keep privilege resolution consistent and safe across the entire codebase.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the specific Privilege enum type
      Parameters:
      targetPrivilegeClass - the target Privilege enum type
      name - the string name of the privilege (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the resolved enum constant, or empty if no match found
